content: braided hand fancy or plain by bonnie dean my favorite sweater is matthew gnagy s reticulated pullover from interweave spring 2012 inspired by that sweater these seamless cabled hand warmers with side gusset thumbs are knit in the round in a dense thick fabric for optimal warmth a video tutorial is included for the optional embroidery embellishment the pattern right hand warmer left hand warmer with smaller needles co 40 sts join to knit in the round with smaller needles co 40 sts join to knit in the round being careful not to twist the sts place a marker to indicate being careful not to twist the sts place a marker to indicate end-of-round end-of-round right cuff ribbing left cuff ribbing k2 p2 4 times k3 p1 k2 p2 3 times k2 p1 k3 p2 40 sts p2 k3 p1 k2 p2 k2 3 times p1 k3 p2 k2 4 times 40 sts work in patt for 1 5 /4 cm work in patt for 1 5 /4 cm lower right hand lower left hand change to larger needles change to larger needles rounds 1-12 k19 work lozenge cable chart over next 16 sts rounds 1-11 k5 work lozenge cable chart over next 16 sts k5 40 sts k19 40 sts thumb gusset thumb gusset round 13 m1l then cont in est patt to end of round 41 sts round 12 work in est patt but after working the last st of the divided as 20 sts 16 chart sts and 5 knit sts round m1l before the end-of-round marker 41 sts divided as 5 knit sts 16 chart sts 20 knit sts round 14 m1l k1 m1r pm work in patt to end of row 43 sts total with 3 gusset sts bet markers round 13 work in patt to last st in round pm m1l k1 m1r 43 sts total with 3 gusset sts bet markers note the first gusset marker is the end-of-round marker marking the beginning of the gusset note the end-of-round marker is the second gusset marker marking the end of the gusset rounds 15-17 work in patt slipping markers when passed and knitting all gusset sts rounds 14-17 work in patt slipping markers when passed and knitting all gusset sts round 18 m1l knit to next gusset marker m1r sm work in patt to end of row 45 sts total with 5 gusset sts bet markers round 18 knit in patt to first gusset marker sm m1l knit to next gusset marker m1r 45 sts total with 5 gusset sts bet rounds 19-34 repeat rounds 15-18 four more times repeating the markers lozenge cable chart after round 23 53 sts total with 13 gusset sts bet markers rounds 19-34 repeat rounds 15-18 four more times repeating lozenge cable chart after round 23 53 sts total round 35 place 13 sts on holder or waste yarn remove 2nd with 13 gusset sts bet markers marker at end of gusset keep end-of-round marker in place use
